result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenan Charles Sharp

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Keenan Charles Sharp in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Keenan Charles Sharp. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received an offer from the State this offer, and is also contemplating a Motion. Discovery has been received. Hearing requested in 45 days.  Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:22 AM Defendant Keenan Charles Sharp in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Keenan Charles Sharp.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Keenan Charles Sharp in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 11:02 AM Defendant Keenan Charles Sharp in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

01:42 PM Defendant Keenan Charles Sharp in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant given a petition for appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
